column1: youre right paul rdna 3 looks very promising and i am really looking forward to its release its been a long time coming and im convinced the end product will have been worth the wait cant wait to hear your views upon release great vids as always keep up the good work
im super excited for rdna3
im freaking stoked to find new 3060s for 400 might be time to upgrade my r9 390 from 2015

rdna 3 hit exactly where i was hoping in performance in a 350 watt envelope the price actually exceeded my expectations i think rdna 3 going to be a hell of a value this generation across the board cant wait to see what they release in the mid range as well

i think ill hang on to my thermalenhanced 3080 founders for now but this is very exciting to see amd catching up this quickly hopefully their drivers are solid as well and we really will have a serious competition on our hands
more gas in the tank sounds great i cant wait to see what aibs do with rdna3 boards bring on the 7970 xd 3ghz edition

im excited for the performance review and the gpu itself just installed a 5800x3d in my pc also with the new av1 encoders id like to see a comparison on how well radeon relive compares to nvidias shadowplay this time
since the flagship is at 355 tdp im really hyped for the midrange options
im really looking forward to a navi refresh next year still tons of headroom left on navi 31 plus more mature drivers for rdna 3 and gives time for third party support for the new features like fsr 2

as a long time 1080ti enjoyer im really happy about rdna3 right now not planning on upgrading my gpu in the near future but its good to know that it would be a straight forward upgrade without the need to change my psu which i got for the 1080ti cables and case lets hope that the launch benchmarks see amd deliver the performance they promise

the most impressive thing about rdna 3 is its cost effectiveness for sure also it seems like if they want to have a stronger card in the future faster memory is a must
4080 should be a 1000
rdna 3 looks very good from a mobile perspective next gen laptops are gonna get very good and the next steamdeck will hopefully have better battery life but probably not lol
amd already having fsr 3 in the works was a big suprise for me

rdna 3 is actually very impressive especially when you take into factor the price i assume the lower than expected prices is due to the lower cost of manufacturing these cards i can also see amd doing a refresh in the future with much higher clocks and more infinity cache the low clocks actually surprised me tbh
hopefully amd gives us an x3d zen 4 soon looking forward to upgrading my 58003080 to a full amd system next year

rdna3 has been much better then i expected not only does it have a great price going for xtx it has all the features youd want plus fsr30 looming the power requirements are also quite good considering the competition ive always been super disappointed in the 40 series just junk
getting disappointed about rt performance is kind of silly

skipped 3 generations waiting for power efficient decent raster price finally it is time and looking forward to what mid range cards are coming
my system will be a full amd again since 2005

it is not dissapointing actually its quite amazing i love both lovelace and rnda3 and think the improvment is amazing people are just dissapointed because they had early rumors saying that performance would be 25 3x which was never possible unless they had best 3nm and faster memory with more shaders
please amd oblige us sympathetic gamers give us another 7970 beast the first one was awesome if you make a 3d stacked overclocked rdna 3 card please consider bringing back the name
looking forward to 2023 amd advantage laptops

belender does support amd radeon cards with hip since blender version 30 which they worked closely with amd to create although nvidas optix denoiser exclusive to nvidia is miles better than the openimagedenoise which is the one and is such with love the videos keep up the great work
yea i love amd i just cant swap as a 3d artist yetif they invest the money into fixing the nvidia gap i believe they will do great

rdna 3 is a beast look how many compute cores they have managed to cram in there and only running at 350w also remember the cores and mem are uncoupled with frequency so the compute cores prob run pretty fast amd really are onto something here and i think for the first time in a long time the gpu market might have some competition
rdna 3 is the ryzen moment in graphics make no mistake amd is now in the technological lead i bet rdna 4 takes the crown and so does rdna 5
would love to see a 7970xt with dual n32 chips
the 7900xtx will be about 3x my 2080super in most games while being just plug and play no upgrades psu needed is 1000 a win for me i can swing the 1k for that much more performance

951 thats why i chose opencl for my computational fluid dynamics software fluidx3d it runs on all hardware and is just as fast as cuda the 7900 xtx finally brings back a 384bit memory bus for 960gbs bandwidth this card should absolutely shred in cfd workloads
cant wait for blackwellrdna4 leaks

the amazing thing about this is that in the future they can make the die bigger with 300mm more space they can up the power requirements and with their chiplet design they can stack memory 1 or 2 high what can nvidia do theyre pretty much maxed out

this gen the 4090 is the best its a 7900 with enough rt for double the money

thank you for this update i think ill get a 7900 xtx instead of an rtx 3080 ti then d

this will be zen1 rx8000 zen 2 rx9000 zen 3 they learnt so much from ryzen in that we may skip from zen1 zen 3 in one generation rx8000 could be the biggest game changer taking everything that rx7000 has and tweaking it to 11

really looking like the 5800x3d 7900xtx is going to be a nice combination for price to performance for gaming amds zen4 and nvidias 4000 series are both just too expensive for many to adopt right now

amd made a good choice keep power cooler size and most importantly price sane winning in rt and by a slim margin in raster is not worth 600 to any consumer who isnt already sold on nvidia regardless this also means prices could be good lower down the stack later which would bode well for value not to mention the lower prices of rdna 2
the only thing i care about is driver compatibility and reliability once thats sorted rdna3 will finally become an option
im actually more interested in where the next generation of midrange cards fall for general gaming that said i bought a 3080ti at msrp so im good for a year or two on my sim vr machine
